mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Prentis, Joseph, 1754-1809
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Communications subsequent to their last meeting appear to have paved way for conciliation; believes letters which have passed through military channels will be relief to person to whom they were addressed; certain persons exciting improper sentiments towards Jefferson; reconciliation in progress.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1803 April 29, W[illia]msburg, [Virginia] to [Thomas Jefferson], n.p.
